{"step_by_step_thinking": "Loss of lamina dura radiographically and high sound on percussion are indicative of replacement resorption. Replacement resorption occurs when the root of the replanted tooth is resorbed and replaced by bone. This can lead to the loss of the tooth over time. Internal resorption refers to resorption occurring within the root canal, external resorption refers to resorption occurring on the external surface of the root, and cervical resorption refers to resorption occurring at the cervical (neck) region of the tooth.", "answer_choice": "C. Replacement resorption"}
